'''Nimrodel''' was the small river that rose in the eastern foothills of the [[Misty Mountains]], and flowed east to meet the [[Celebrant]] on the western borders of [[Lothlórien]]. When the [[Fellowship of the Ring]] came to the river they could hear it splashing over a waterfall on their right.  There used to be a [[Bridge of Nimrodel|bridge]] but it had long ago disappeared.  It was said that the water of the stream was "''healing to the weary''". After passing through [[Moria|Khazad-dûm]], the Fellowship crossed and stopped by the Nimrodel to rest.<ref>{{FR|II6}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''1982-97: ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]'':'''
:Nimrodel is a stream of 25 miles.<ref>{{ICE|4002}}</ref>

'''1995-8: ''[[Middle-earth Collectible Card Game]]'':'''
:With the Resource Event ''Healing of Nimrodel'', players can heal their characters.

[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Nimrodel (river).jpg|thumb|250px|left|The Falls of Nimrodel in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
'''2009: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The river originates at [[Zirakzigil]] and is known as "Labam-gairu" to the Dwarves. At the Falls of Nimrodel, a statue of [[Nimrodel|the lady herself]] is erected on a small island.
